ai.summary: A 10.3 km moderate hike around the Dolaucothi Estate in Wales, UK. The route combines grassy farmland tracks, woodlands and open viewpoints with a steady, rolling profile that typically takes 3-4 hours to complete depending on pace and stops. Expect scenic valley views near the Cothi valley and close proximity to the historic Dolaucothi Gold Mines managed by National Trust.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-defined trails with a mix of grassy fields, compact stone paths and woodland sections. Elevation changes are moderate with occasional short climbs and some exposed viewpoints. Sections can be muddy after rain; watch for uneven ground and occasional stiles. Some areas may pass near farm gates and livestock.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast and daylight hours; wear sturdy hiking boots and suitable layers; stay on marked paths and respect farm boundaries; be mindful of livestock and gate etiquette; watch for uneven ground and potential mine openings near historic sites; carry a map, compass or GPS; tell someone your route and expected return; carry water, snacks and a lightweight rain jacket.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn for best conditions and daylight; hikes can be done year-round with proper gear, though winter weather may be muddy and daylight shorter.

seo.title: Dolaucothi Estate Trail – 10.3 km Moderate Hike in Wales, UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the 10.3 km Dolaucothi Estate Trail in Wales. A moderate, scenic hike through the Dolaucothi Estate with meadow, woodland paths, and valley views. Includes safety tips and gear for UK hikers.
seo.h1: Dolaucothi Estate Trail – 10.3 km Moderate Hike in Wales, UK
